title: Why these billionaires are funding a massive treasure hunt in Greenland
description: A climate crisis-induced ice melt is making Greenland the epicenter of the dire impacts of climate change, while also creating opportunities to find new sources of precious metals needed to power green energy. Many companies are already scrambling to mine these essential resources. CNN's René Marsh reports.

title: Olivia Newton-John, 'Grease' star and Grammy-winning singer, dead at 73
CDC adds popular Middle Eastern destination and tiny Dutch island to 'high' risk category
description: A popular Middle Eastern destination and a tiny Dutch Caribbean island were added to the CDC's "high" risk category for travel on Monday.

title: Beyonce debuts remix of Madonna's 'Vogue' honoring Black icons
description: Beyoncé honors Black female icons in a new remix of "Break My Soul," which reimagines Madonna's "Vogue."

title: The 'Grease' star and Grammy-winning singer revealed in September 2018 that she was treating cancer at the base of her spine
US Navy recovers jet blown off aircraft carrier from bottom of ocean
description: A US Navy team recovered a military jet from a depth of 9,500 feet in the Mediterranean Sea on August 3 after the aircraft had blown overboard during "unexpected heavy weather" in July, a release from US Naval Forces Europe-Africa said.

title: John Travolta pays tribute to Olivia Newton-John
description: Actor John Travolta, who co-starred with Olivia Newton-John in the hit movie musical "Grease," has posted a statement in tribute to the late singer.

title: Looking back at Olivia Newton-John's iconic moments
description: Olivia Newton-John, the Australian singer whose breathy voice and wholesome beauty made her one of the biggest pop stars of the '70s and charmed generations of viewers in the blockbuster movie "Grease," has died, according to a statement from her husband. She was 73.

title: Alex Jones' texts have been turned over to the January 6 committee, source says
description: Approximately two years' worth of text messages sent and received by right-wing conspiracy theorist Alex Jones have been turned over to the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection, a person familiar with the matter told CNN on Monday.

title: Killings of four Muslim men in Albuquerque have the city on edge
Friends start GoFundMe for woman who lost her home in Anne Heche car crash
description: The woman whose home was destroyed when Anne Heche crashed her car into it "narrowly escaped physical harm," according to friends.

title: 60% of European Union and UK land is now facing drought conditions
description: Sixty percent of land in the European Union and United Kingdom -- an area bigger than Alaska and Texas combined -- is under either drought warnings or alerts, according to the European Drought Observatory.

title: Why Hamas stayed out of the latest Gaza conflict
description: One of the most important aspects of the weekend's short but violent conflict between Israel and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) was what didn't happen: Hamas' involvement.

title: How Biden's big win could change America
Billionaires are funding a massive treasure hunt in Greenland as ice vanishes
description: Some of the world's richest men are funding a massive treasure hunt, complete with helicopters and transmitters, on the Southwest coast of Greenland.

title: Top US general was set to excoriate Trump in unreleased resignation letter: New Yorker
description: In the wake of then-President Donald Trump's infamous photo-op at the height of the George Floyd protests, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Gen. Mark Milley penned a lengthy and vociferous critique of Trump in a resignation letter he ultimately never sent, The New Yorker reported on Monday.

title: 'Suicidal' shelling around Ukrainian nuclear plant condemned
China drills show Beijing is developing the ability to strangle Taiwan, experts say
Trump-backed candidate for Michigan AG under criminal investigation for possibly tampering with voting machines
description: Michigan's Democratic attorney general is calling for a special prosecutor to investigate her Donald Trump-backed challenger after finding evidence linking him to a potentially criminal plot to seize and tamper with voting machines used in the 2020 election, according to a letter obtained by CNN and documents released Monday by the attorney general's office.

title: North Korea is destroying sites at resort area once hailed as a symbol of peace
description: Once hailed as a symbol of peace between the Koreas, a floating hotel in a resort area is being destroyed by the North Korean government.

title: It's a boy! Cincinnati Zoo seeking names for new baby hippo
description: The new baby hippo born last week at the Cincinnati Zoo is a boy, the zoo announced Monday.

title: Warren Buffett's company lost $44 billion last quarter, but it's not really bad news
description: Warren Buffett is just like the rest of us. He got crushed by the plunge in the stock market during the first half of the year. But the Oracle of Omaha is undeterred by the wildness on Wall Street. Berkshire Hathaway is still buying and many of the the company's diverse business lines are still thriving, even in these uncertain economic times.

title: Earth broke the record for the shortest day since atomic clocks were invented
description: If you feel like there's less time in the day, you're correct.

title: Photos show handwritten notes that Trump apparently ripped up and attempted to flush down toilet
description: Newly revealed photographs reveal two occasions on which former President Donald Trump apparently flushed documents down the toilet.

title: South Korea's Kim Joo-hyung, 20, soars to historic first PGA Tour win
description: South Korea's Kim "Tom" Joo-Hyung became the second-youngest winner on the PGA Tour since the Second World War with a convincing win at the Wyndham Championship on Sunday.

title: Chad's military government signs peace agreement with rebel groups in Doha
description: Chad's transitional government has signed a peace deal with rebel groups on Monday in Doha, according to the Qatari Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: This is what worries Taiwan's FM the most about China
description: It the wake of live-fire exercises by China following US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to the island, Taiwan's Foreign Minister Joseph Wu says he is worried about a full-scale war and says they must show they are not scared of Beijing.

title: Au secours! France is running out of mustard
description: Hoping to bring some mustard home from France? It might actually be the last place you'll find some at the moment. France's most notorious condiment is running out, and there is no sign of its return to the shelves.

title: Britney Spears addresses Kevin Federline's claims about her relationship with their sons
description: Britney Spears is saddened by her ex-husband's recent comments about her relationship with their teenage sons.

title: 'You're guilty for enjoying your sexuality': Says actress fighting shame culture
description: Actress Rana Alamuddin created a viral movement that has empowered women across the Middle East to break free of the guilt and societal expectations that have been holding them back from for years.

title: Pink Floyd's co-founder accuses Biden of 'huge crime' in Ukraine. Hear why
description: CNN's Michael Smerconish joins New Day to talk about his wide-ranging interview with Pink Floyd co-founder Roger Waters, where they discuss the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, and the ongoing tensions between China and Taiwan.

title: Pete Rose dismisses questions over statutory rape claims in return to Philadelphia: 'It was 55 years ago, babe'
description: Major League Baseball's all-time hits leader Pete Rose returned to the field in Philadelphia for the first time since receiving a lifetime ban from baseball in 1989.

title: Willow Smith speaks out about dad Will's Oscars slap incident
description: Willow Smith says she was not fazed by the media firestorm that broke out after her father, Will Smith, slapped Chris Rock at the 2022 Academy Awards, because she sees her "whole family as being human."

title: What should people know about Paxlovid rebound? Our medical analyst explains
description: After being diagnosed with Covid-19 last month, President Joe Biden recently tested negative for the coronavirus, only to test positive again a few days later. Biden had taken the antiviral medication Paxlovid, which has been associated with some patients testing positive again for the virus after completing treatment.

title: Erling Haaland sets out frightening marker as he scores brace in Premier League debut
description: Erling Haaland's game seems tailormade for the Premier League, and he displayed why on Sunday afternoon in London.

title: 'Reinvented' Nick Kyrgios makes history with singles and doubles wins at Citi Open
description: Nick Kyrgios backed up his appearance in the Wimbledon final by becoming the first person to win the Citi Open men's singles and doubles titles at the same tournament on Sunday, as well as becoming the first Australian to win the singles title multiple times following his victory in 2019.

title: They came for a beach holiday. Now they're trapped in China's latest Covid lockdown
description: Known for its sandy beaches, luxury resorts and duty-free shopping, the city of Sanya on China's tropical Hainan island has long been a popular getaway for Chinese middle- and upper-class families.

title: BBC soap legend June Spencer retires at age 103
description: June Spencer, the last original cast member of BBC Radio 4 drama "The Archers," has retired from the show after more than 70 years, at the age of 103.

title: The man saving retro Japanese vending machines from the trash
description: There's a reason Sagamihara, Japan, isn't in travel guides. It's a sprawling commuter city for nearby Yokohama and Tokyo; a mix of main roads, light industrial estates and quiet towns people go through rather than stop.

title: Belarusian tennis star Victoria Azarenka forced to withdraw from Toronto tournament due to visa issue
description: Belarusian tennis star Victoria Azarenka has been forced to withdraw from the National Bank Open in Toronto after her visa application to enter Canada was rejected, she wrote on Twitter.

title: Drought reveals unexploded WWII bomb in Italy's dried-up Po River
description: Heatwaves sweeping Europe this summer have brought not just record high temperatures and scorched fields: The drought-stricken waters of Italy's Po River are running so low they revealed a previously submerged World War II bomb.

title: China posts record $101 billion trade surplus but export boom could fade
description: China's export sector delivered robust growth in July, providing much-need support for the world's second largest economy that is almost certain to miss its GDP target this year.

title: Drills show China is developing the ability to strangle Taiwan
This brown British prime minister would be no victory
description: Britain is as close as it has ever been to being run by a prime minister who is not White. When Boris Johnson eventually skulks out of office, he will be replaced by either Rishi Sunak, son of Indian migrants via East Africa, or Liz Truss who is doing her best Margaret Thatcher impression.

title: A London museum is returning dozens of looted artifacts
description: A London museum has agreed to return 72 objects looted from Benin City in 1897 to the Nigerian government.

title: Former Trump aide calls Trump's CPAC speech 'shameful'
description: Former Trump aide Alyssa Farah Griffin reacts to former President Donald Trump's speech at CPAC, calling it "shameful" that he made light of Cassidy Hutchinson's testimony about the January 6th insurrection.

title: Million-dollar heist caught on camera
description: Police in New York are seeking information about a group of masked men who quickly robbed a jewelry store in the Bronx of more than $2 million in jewelry.
